CHAT.comment: Chi is hesitant to write and takes a long time to get started. Mot provides most of the ideas for Chi's letter , including bringing up the holes through the pages. EXP also gives Chi idea of signing the letter. Chi pays close attention to proper spelling and is often prompted to do so by Mot. Chi does not want Mot to be able to see her work , and writes for most of the time with one arm shielding the page

u.a: MOT and EXP discuss the goals of the research for a few minutes . Mot also gets up to get something from the kitchen and lets the dog outside . Chi may be reading or looking through the book
MOT and EXP discuss the how the tape recorder functions for a minute
Chi may have handed book back to EXP; EXP suggests keeping it so Chi can spell the author's name
Chi is writing with her arm curled around paper to shield her work from view
Chi may be asking Mot to help her spell through
buzzer sounds and there is a conversation among Fat , MOT , and EXP about the football games of the day . Mot leaves the room .
Chi may be referring to orientation of paper or whether or not she's supposed to use up both pages
Chi has a phone number written on her hand
MOT is reading from Chi's letter
ringing noise can be heard; maybe a pencil tapping against a glass
there is a thump , probably Chi moving her arms to block Mot's view of the letter
Chi may be shielding paper with her arm again
pause of 0:26 seconds follows as Chi writes
